►底知れぬほど深い　bottomless; fathomless
・(足がつかない)深いところへ行く　go ┏beyond [out of] one's depth
・深いところへ行くな.　Don't go out of [Keep within] your depth.
・(魚が)深いところに住んでいる　live at depth
・深い池　a deep pond
・深い海の底の生物　creatures that live deep on the ocean floor
・深い地下からわいてくる泉　a deep spring of water
・深い鍋　a deep ┏pot [pan]
・深い穴を掘る　dig a deep hole
・深いしわ　deep wrinkles; deeply etched lines 《in one's face》
・深い傷　a deep wound.
►雪が深くて歩きにくかった.　The deep snow made walking difficult.
・その木は根が深くて掘り起こすのが大変だった.　The roots of the tree ran so deep it was hard to dig it up.
・水は大して深くなかった.　The water wasn't very deep.
・この湖は一番深いところで 20 メートルある.　The lake goes down 20 meters at its deepest.
2 〔奥までの距離が長い〕 deep.
►深い山　deep in the mountains
・深い森　a ┏deep [dense] forest
・懐が深い力士　a sumo wrestler with a long reach.
3 〔密度が濃い〕 thick; dense; heavy.
►深い霧　a ┏thick [dense] fog
・深い闇　profound darkness
・深い草むらの中に身を隠す　hide (oneself) in thick grass.
4 〔色が濃い〕
►深い緑　deep [dark] green.
5 〔関係が濃い〕 close; fast; intimate; 《口》 thick.
►深い関係　a close [an intimate] relationship
・深い仲　⇒ふかいなか
・深いなじみ　long acquaintance; 〔なじみの人〕 an acquaintance of long standing; an intimate acquaintance
・深いつながりがある　have a close connection.
6 〔たけなわである〕
►私が彼に会ったのは秋も深い10 月だった.　I first met him in October, as autumn was deepening.
・夜も深い頃突然の悲報を受けた.　I received the sad news suddenly, late ┏at [in the] night.
7 〔深遠な〕 deep; profound.
►深い意味　a profound meaning
・深い考え　(a) deep thought; a profound idea
・深いたくらみ　a deep plot
・深いわけ　a profound reason
・深い味わいがある　have a ┏deep [profound] meaning; be deeply significant.
►囲碁はやってみるとなかなか奥が深い.　Now that I've started to play go, I can see how deep (a game) it is.
8 〔程度が甚だしい〕 intense; strong.
►深い愛情　deep affection(s)
・深い眠り　a ┏deep [profound, sound, heavy] sleep
・深い学識　profound [deep] learning
・深い悲しみ　deep sadness
・深い感動を覚える　be deeply moved
・深い印象　a strong [a deep, a profound, an indelible] impression
・深い痛手　a serious ┏blow [wound]
・深いため息をつく　sigh deeply; breathe a deep sigh.
►彼女は歴史について造詣が深い.　She has a ┏profound [deep] knowledge of history.
・あの人は野球に関しては知識, 経験ともに深い.　He is thoroughly familiar with baseball in terms of both knowledge and experience.
・彼の犯した罪は深い.　He has committed a grave offense.
・彼女は欲が深い人間だ.　She is an extremely greedy person.
深く　1 〔底や奥までの距離が長いさま〕 deep(ly); dead [sound] 《asleep》; profoundly.
►深く掘る　dig deep(ly)
・深く沈む[潜る]　sink [dive] deep(ly)
・…に深く頭を下げる　bow deeply to…
・いすに深く腰をかける　sit back in one's chair
・深く根ざした　deep-rooted; deep-seated; (deeply) ingrained
・深く息を吸う　breathe (in) deep(ly); take [draw] a deep breath.
2 〔関係が強いさま〕
►…と深く交わっている　be on intimate terms with…
・深くつながっている　have a ┏close [strong] connection; be tied closely together
・深くかかわる　be deeply involved 《with…》.
3 〔精神作用の甚だしいさま〕 (心底から) heartily; sincerely; (十分に) fully; thoroughly; completely; (強く) intensely; strongly; very much.
►物事を深く考える　think deep(ly) 《about…》; reflect deeply on things
・深く研究する[学ぶ]　study thoroughly; make a profound study 《of…》
・広く読むより深く読む　read deeply rather than widely
・深く追及する　pursue 《a matter》 deeply
・深く愛する　love sb ┏deeply [dearly]
・深く後悔する　regret deeply
・深く反省する　be deeply sorry 《for…》
・彼を深くとがめぬほうがよい.　You shouldn't criticize him too harshly.
深くする　deepen; make [become] deeper.
►穴を深くする　make [dig] a hole deeper
・…の感[思い]を深くする　feel keenly that…
・感銘を深くする　be deeply ┏impressed [touched] 《by [with]…》.
深くなる　deepen; become deeper.
►岬のあたりは急に深くなっているところがあるから気をつけなさい.　Be careful. The water gets deep(er) very quickly near the cape.
・プールの中央部は深くなっている.　The pool is deeper ┏toward [in] the middle.
・霧が次第に深くなった.　The fog gradually grew thicker.
・秋も深くなった.　Autumn is ┏well [far] advanced. ｜ Autumn is well ┏along [on].
・彼らの関係は深くなっていった.　Their relationship grew intimate. ｜ They became deeply involved with each other.
・老いた母の姿を見て私の悲しみはより深くなった.　My sadness deepened when I saw how old my mother had become.
・調査の結果ますますその疑いが深くなった.　Suspicion deepened as a result of the investigation.
・年を取るに従い彼はますます欲が深くなった.　He grew more greedy with age.

ふらふら [ローマ字](furafura)
1 〔物や身体が安定しないさま〕 unsteadily; totteringly; shakily.
►ふらふらする　〔揺れ動く〕 wobble; sway back and forward; roll about; 〔足元が〕 be ┏unsteady [shaky] 《on one's feet》; (ボクシングでさんざん打たれて, または病気や精神的衝撃により) be groggy; be punch-drunk; be shaky; (酩酊して) 《口》 be rocky; totter; dodder; stagger; reel
・疲労[空腹]でふらふらになっている　be faint with ┏fatigue [hunger]
・ふらふらになるまで走らされる　be made to run until one's legs give way
・ふらふら(と)立ち上がる　reel [totter, stagger] to one's feet
・ふらふら(と)歩く　walk unsteadily.
►私は頭がふらふらする.　My brain reels. ｜ My head ┏swims [spins]. ｜ I feel dizzy.
・私は足がふらふらする.　My legs are giving way.
・長わずらいのあとなのでまだちょっと足元がふらふらしています.　I'm still a bit wobbly on my legs after my long illness.
・人形の首がふらふらして取れそうだ.　The doll's head is wobbling about and looks as if it will come off.
・彼はあっちにふらふらこっちにふらふらぶつかりながら歩いていった.　He was careening this way and that, bumping into things as he walked.
2 〔心や態度が安定しないさま〕 unsteadiness; vacillation; wavering.
►ふらふらする　be unsteady [waver] 《in one's ┏mind [resolution]》; vacillate; falter.
►彼女はまだ気持ちがふらふらしているようだ.　She still seems to be wavering.
・定職にもつかずふらふらしている若者が増えた.　An increasing number of young people are hesitating to take up steady jobs.
・彼はふらふらと日和見主義的にいろんな党を渡り歩いている.　He flits about opportunistically from one party to another.
・どこをふらふらほっつき歩いているやら, 兄貴はまだ帰ってこない.　I don't know where my brother is ┏gadding about [bumming around], but he still hasn't come home.
3 〔無自覚に行動するさま〕 unconsciously; unawares; without knowing it; in spite of oneself; before one knows (it); whimsically.
►盛り場をふらふらさまよう　moon about an entertainment spot
・ついふらふらと人の物に手を出す　〔盗む〕 unthinkingly snatch someone else's belongings.
►私はふらふらとその店に入っていった.　I casually stepped into the shop. ｜ I went into the store ┏without any [for no] particular purpose.
・甘い言葉に誘われてふらふらっとついていってしまった.　Seduced by his smooth talk, she went along without knowing what she was doing.

ふたん【負担】 [ローマ字](futan)
1 〔分担するもの〕 a burden; (賦課) an imposition; (責任) a responsibility; a liability; (義務) an obligation; (支出) defrayment; (租税の) incidence; 【法】 (借地人が地主に納める負担金) a fine.
〜する bear [shoulder] 《a burden》; take sth upon oneself; (一部を) share 《in…》.
►費用を負担する　bear [shoulder, stand] the expense; meet the cost

・生活費を負担する　share living expenses; help sb meet his living expenses
・医療費の 3 割を負担する　bear 30% of medical costs
・費用は彼が全部自分で負担した.　He assumed responsibility for all the expenses. ｜ 《口》 He picked up the entire check.
・僕もその費用の幾分かを負担した.　I contributed my share of the expenses.
・送料は買い手の方で負担しなければならない.　Shipping costs must be charged to the purchaser.
・交通費は私が負担しよう.　I'll take care of transportation costs.
・負担させる　saddle [burden] sb with…; charge 《expenses》 to sb; place a burden upon sb; impose 《a tax》 on 《the people》.
►背負いきれない負担　an unbearable burden
・うちはとてもそんな重い負担は引き受けられない.　We can't take on such a heavy ┏burden [obligation].
►負担が多すぎる　have too many responsibilities; have too many things on one's ┏hands [mind, 《口》 plate]
・それでは君の負担が重すぎる.　That would make the burden too heavy for you.
►雇用者の負担で　at the employer's expense
・受益者の負担で　at the beneficiary's expense.
►このリサイクル費用はだれの負担になるのですか.　Who is going to be liable for these recycling fees?
・その費用は利用者の負担になる.　The expenses are charged to the user. ｜ The cost falls on the user.
・治療費は全部加害者の負担になる.　All medical expenses are borne by the guilty party.
►負担の過重に苦しむ　suffer under a heavy burden.
►負担を軽減する　reduce [alleviate] a burden
・仕事の負担を軽くする　lighten [lessen] the workload
・負担を重くする　increase the ┏burden [load]
・過重の負担を背負わされた国民　an overly burdened people.
►それは国庫の負担です.　It will be charged to the National Treasury.
2 〔重荷〕 a burden; an onus; a load.

・普通3 時間かかる.　It usually takes three hours.

・この地方では大家族は普通であって例外ではない.　In this district large families are the rule and not the exception.
・この本は普通だったら 2,000 円するのですが, われわれは 1,000 円で買えるのです.　Although this book ordinarily costs \2,000, we can buy it for only \1,000.

がんばり【頑張り】 [ローマ字](ganbari)
pluck; perseverance; doggedness; endurance; tenacity; 《口》 fight; guts.
►がんばりが利く　be tenacious; be persistent
・がんばりが利かない　give in easily
・君はがんばりが足りない.　You don't have enough ┏perseverance [fight]. ｜ You ┏give up too easily [don't keep at it enough].
►さて, もうひとがんばりしよう.　Right, I'll ┏try (it) again [give it another go, have another try]. ｜ I'll keep at it a little longer.
◧がんばりどころ
►さあ, ここ[今]ががんばりどころだ.　Okay! This is where we show ┏our grit [what we're made of]. ｜ *All right! Hang in there now.
がんばり屋　a person who ┏doesn't give up [keeps at it, keeps fighting]; a fighter; a persistent person; 《口》 a bitter-ender.
►彼はがんばり屋だね.　He doesn't give up easily. ｜ He's ┏very game [plucky, persistent]. ｜ He has plenty of fight.

がんばりズム【頑張りズム】 [ローマ字](ganbarizumu)

がんばる【頑張る】 [ローマ字](ganbaru)
1 〔一生懸命に努力する〕 be tenacious; be persistent; keep at it; do not give ┏up [in] easily; give 《a job》 ┏one's all [everything one has got]; hold out; stick ┏to [at] it; 〔さかんに活動する〕 be full of ┏energy [pep, bounce].
►がんばり抜く　〔がんばり通す〕 keep going [hold out] to the end; do not give ┏up [in] half way; stay the course
・がんばり抜いた者が勝ちだ.　Victory goes to the person who can stay the course. ｜ Endurance is rewarded. ｜ If you keep fighting you get there in the end.
・がんばって原書を読了する　read a book all the way through in the original language.
►〔競技などで〕 がんばれ!　Do your best. ｜ Keep it up. ｜ Don't give ┏up [in]. ｜ Keep fighting. ｜ *《口》 Hang in there!
・がんばれ, 日本!　Keep fighting, Japan! ｜ Show them what you're made of, Japan!
・あと 100 メートルだ, がんばれ!　There's only another hundred meters; ┏keep it up [ᐦgo it]!
・〔スポーツの演技などで〕 いよいよ本番だね, がんばってね.　Right, this is it; ┏Good luck [Do your best, Show them what you're made of]!
・「これから就職の面接です」「がんばれよ」　"I'm just going to a job interview."―"Good luck! ｜ Do your best!"
・金メダルめざしてがんばります.　I'll ┏do my best to get [go all out for] the gold.
・私はまだやめない, もう少しがんばってみる.　I'm not giving in yet; I'll keep at it a little more.
・ほう, がんばってるね.　I am impressed by ┏your perseverance [your tenacity, the way you're keeping at it]. ▶am に強勢を置く. ｜ You are working hard! ▶are に強勢を置く.
・よくがんばったね.　〔競技の後〕 (勝ったとき) Great!; Well done! ｜ (負けたとき) Bad luck, but ┏it was a good fight [you did your very best, you really tried].
・よくがんばったが, 負けは負けだ.　You ┏did a good job [tried hard, put up a good fight], but defeat is defeat.
・いくらがんばってもあいつには追いつけない.　However hard I try, I'll never ┏catch up [be able to keep up] with him. ｜ It's no good; he'll always be better than me.
・最後までお掃除がんばった子にはごほうびだ.　There'll be something for any of you who keep up the cleaning till you've finished.
・力一杯がんばれば合格できる.　If you ┏really do your utmost [try your very hardest, put everything you have into it] you'll pass.
・もうこれ以上がんばれない, 疲れました.　I can't keep on any longer [I've done all I can]. I'm exhausted. ｜ I'm finished. There's no more fight in me.
・もうすぐテストだ, がんばらなくちゃ.　The exams are right ahead. I must really ┏work [get down to it, put my back into it]. ｜ The exams are imminent. I must work harder.
・もうすぐ山頂だ, みんな, がんばろう!　Come on [Keep it up, Keep fighting, Don't let up now], everybody! We're nearly at the top.
・そんなにがんばらなくていいんだよ.　There's no need to push yourself like that.
・この町では古くからの商店ががんばっている.　The old shops in this area ┏are putting up a fight [aren't giving in easily].
・親父ががんばっていてなかなか息子に身上(しんしょう)を譲らない.　The father is pretty tenacious. He isn't handing over the business to the son easily. ｜ The old man's hanging ┏on hard [*《口》 in there] and he's pretty reluctant to let the son take over.
2 〔自説を主張し続ける〕 insist that…; insist 《that one is right》; stick to 《one's opinion》; keep ┏saying [repeating] sth; continue to claim; 〔屈しない〕 do not give in; stand ┏firm [fast]; hold on; show one's mettle.
►どこまでもがんばる　absolutely refuse to ┏change (one's views) [give in, yield]; continue to maintain that…; 《口》 stick it out; 〔意見を捨てない〕 stick to one's ┏views [《口》 guns]
・知らぬ存ぜぬでがんばり通した.　He ┏admitted nothing [kept his mouth closed] to the very end. ｜ He insisted to the end that he knew nothing.
►君ががんばり続ければお父さんだってきっと折れる.　If you just ┏hold on [《口》 stick to your guns, *hang in there], I bet your father will give in. ｜ As long as you don't give in, your father will accept it sooner or later.
・彼女がうんと言うまでがんばるつもりだ.　I'm not going to give up until she ┏agrees [accepts, says yes]. ｜ I'm ┏determined to [going to] make her agree.
・「先生の解釈はやはり承服できません. 私のではだめですか」「君もがんばるねえ」　"I still can't accept your interpretation. Isn't mine possible?"―"You're very determined, aren't you [You don't give in easily, do you]?"
3 〔居座り続ける〕 refuse to ┏move [leave]; stay on; hang on; hang onto 《power》; do not budge.
►スキャンダルもものかは首相は未だにがんばっている.　In spite of the scandals, the Prime Minister is hanging on [refusing to budge, struggling on].
・入口には警官が一人まだがんばっていた.　One policeman still remained at the entrance.
・立ち退きに反対して今もがんばっている農家が一軒ある.　One single farming family is still resolutely ┏maintaining its opposition to the eviction order [refusing to move out].

げんざい２【現在】 [ローマ字](genzai)
1 〔今〕 as of…; presently; 《at》 the present time; now.
►今日現在　as of today
・3 月 31 日現在の年齢　the age as of 31 March
・表のデータは 2003 年 9 月 1 日現在.　Data given in the table are as of 1 September 2003.
・正午現在の台風の位置　the position of the typhoon as of noon.
►現在まで(のところ)　up to now; to date.
►現在では　at present; nowadays; presently
・現在でも　even now
・高校生の就職内定率は 1 月末現在でも 80 パーセント弱にすぎない.　The percentage of high school students who have received employment offers stands at slightly under 80 percent even now at the end of January.
►現在に至るまで　up [down] to the present (day); up to now
・〔履歴書で〕 現在に至る.　Current as of 《1 January 2003》.
・二つの大戦を経て現在に至るヨーロッパの現代史　a modern history of Europe covering the two world wars and coming down to the present
・創立者の理念は現在に受け継がれている.　The ideals of the founder have been passed on to the present day.
►現在の　present; existing; current
・現在の状態　the ┏present [existing] state of affairs
・現在の夫[住所]　one's present ┏husband [address]
・現在の世界記録　the ┏standing [existing, present] world record
・当時のセイロン, 現在のスリランカ　《in》 Ceylon as it was known then, Sri Lanka as it is known today
・現在のところ(では)　at present; at this time; as of now; (当分) for the time being; 〔今の状態では〕 as ┏matters [things, affairs] now stand; in the present situation; under existing circumstances
・現在のところ判明しているのは以上です.　This much is what is known (about the matter) at present [at this time].
・現在のままにしておく　leave 《a matter》 as it ┏is [stands] (now)
・現在の工場の規模ではこれ以上の増産は見込めない.　Given its present scale, the factory cannot be expected to increase production more than it has.
・私は現在の地位に満足している.　I am happy ┏where I am [with my present position].
・店舗数を現在の 60 から来年度中には 100 に増やしたい.　We want to increase the number of ┏stores [shops] from the present 60 to 100 within the next fiscal year.
►昨年学部を卒業し, 現在大学院に在学中.　Completed undergraduate studies last year; presently ┏doing postgraduate studies [in graduate school].
・この理論は現在でも十分通用する.　This theory is fully valid even today.
2 【文法】 the present tense.
◧現在位置　one's [it's] present position; the present position 《of…》.
現在員　the members presently on the ┏list [roll].
現在会員数　the present membership (of the society); the number of members presently on the books.
現在過去未来　present, past and future; past, present and future.
現在完了(時制)　【文法】 the present perfect (tense).
現在形　【文法】 the present form 《of the verb》.
現在時制　【文法】 the present (tense).
現在進行形　【文法】 the present progressive form.
►現在進行形の　ongoing; …in progress
・エイズは現在進行形の問題だ.　AIDS is an ongoing problem.
・ホロコーストは過去ではなく, 世界の多くの地域で現在進行形の悲劇である.　The Holocaust is not a thing of the past but a tragedy still ┏continuing [taking place, unfolding] in many parts of the world.
・その戦争の様子が現在進行形で伝わってきた.　The war situation was conveyed to us in real time.

・釣り銭をごまかす　shortchange 《a customer》; stiff sb on his change
・年齢をごまかす　misrepresent [lie about, hide] one's age
・品質をごまかして高く売る　falsify quality in order to sell at a higher price
・目方をごまかして売る　give short weight
・観客の目をごまかす　deceive an audience's eyes.
►ごまかし合うのはやめて本音で話し合いましょう.　Let's not kid each other and talk straight.
・自分の気持ちをごまかさずに生きたい.　I'd like to live without self-deception.
・人はだませても神様の目はごまかせない.　You may be able to fool some people, but the eye of God sleeps not.
2 〔とりつくろう〕 cover up; gloss [smooth] over; 〔隠蔽する〕 conceal; disguise.
►過失をごまかす　gloss [smooth] over one's fault; cover one's mistake
・筆の先でごまかす　gloss over with (a few strokes of) the pen
・口先でごまかす　talk one's way out 《of a difficult situation》; dissemble; prevaricate
・小手先でごまかす　weasel [worm, finagle] one's way out 《of a difficult situation》
・笑ってごまかす　disguise [camouflage] sth with a laugh
・適当にごまかしておく　fake one's way through; go through the motions.
►ごまかすな.　Don't (try to) talk your way out of it.
・私はうまくごまかしてその場を離れた.　I managed artfully to slip away from there.
・理由を追及されたがうまくごまかした.　They started asking me about my reasons but I talked my way out of it.
・彼の言い訳にごまかされてしまった.　I fell for his excuses.
3 〔不正に細工する〕 cook (up); doctor; tamper with…; 〔着服する〕 pocket; peculate; embezzle 《public money》.
►勘定書をごまかす　doctor [alter, fudge] a bill
・ガスのメーターをごまかす　tamper with the gas meter
・数字をごまかす　juggle with figures.

►可燃[燃える]ごみ　combustible [burnable, flammable] garbage [trash]
・不燃[燃えない]ごみ　nonburnable [nonflammable] garbage [trash]
・燃えるごみと燃えないごみを分ける　separate burnable from nonburnable trash
・今日は燃えるごみ[燃えないごみ, 資源ごみ]の日だ.　Today is ┏burnable trash [nonburnable trash, recycling] day.

・行楽地のごみ　picnic-ground litter.
►ごみだらけの部屋　a ┏littered [filthy, messy] room
・(小さすぎて)ごみみたいな字　tiny, illegible characters (like flecks of dirt).

・カラスがごみを散らかす.　Crows strew garbage all over.
・ここにごみを捨てないでください.　〔掲示〕 No litter please. ｜ No dumping.

ぐあい【具合】 [ローマ字](guai)
1 〔物事の状態・調子〕 a condition; a situation; a state; how sth is proceeding.
►天気の具合　the weather; the weather condition(s); how the weather is
・仕事の進み具合をチェックする　check how work is progressing
・このステーキの焼き具合は見事だ.　This steak is done to a turn.
・寄付金の集まり具合はどうですか.　How is the donations situation (going)?
►(機械などの)具合がよい　be in good (working) ┏condition [order]; be in (good) ┏shape [trim]
・(機械などの)具合が悪い　be out of ┏order [gear, shape, trim, 《口》 kilter]; have something wrong 《with it》
・この機械, どうも最近具合が悪いんですよ.　Something has been [There has been something] wrong [the matter] with this machine recently. ｜ This machine just isn't working properly.
・引出しの具合が悪い.　The drawers do not move smoothly.
・新しい入れ歯はとても具合がいい.　My new false teeth are really good. ｜ I feel really good with my new dentures.
►よい具合に, 具合よく　fortunately; luckily; happily; by (a stroke of) good luck
・実にうまい具合にそこに彼が現れた.　He turned up just at the right time. ｜ It was a stroke of luck that he appeared just at that time.
・ずっとこういう具合にいけばいいけど.　If only things could keep going ┏like this [at this rate].
・私がやるとどうもそううまい具合には行かない.　When I do it, it doesn't work so well.
►具合の悪いことに　unluckily; unfortunately; by ill luck; as ill luck would have it.
►生徒の筋肉の発達具合を見ながらトレーニング方法を決めます.　I decide on student training regimens while watching how their muscles develop.
►そういった具合だ.　That's how things are. ｜ That's the situation.
・そちらはどんな具合ですか.　How are things (with you)? ｜ How is everything out there? ｜ What's the situation with you?
・今のところこんな具合である.　That's how things are at the moment. ｜ That's the way the matter stands at present.
2 〔健康状態〕 one's health; one's condition; one's shape.
►体の具合が悪い　be [feel] unwell [sick, ill]; be in poor health; be in bad shape; 《口》 be [feel] out of sorts; be under the weather
・腹の具合が悪い　be sick to one's stomach; feel ┏queasy [nauseous, sick]
・胃の具合が悪い.　Something is wrong [There's something wrong] with my stomach.
・体の具合が悪いから彼には会えない.　I feel too ill to meet him.
・赤ん坊はどこか具合が悪そうだ.　Something seems to be the matter with the baby.
►風邪の具合はいかがですか.　How's your cold? ｜ Is your cold any better?
・お父様の具合はいかがですか.　How's your father (doing, getting along)?
3 〔都合〕 convenience.
►具合がよい[悪い]　〈物事が主語〉 be ┏convenient [inconvenient]
・明日は具合が悪いなあ.　Tomorrow will not be convenient (for me). ｜ I'm afraid tomorrow's no good.
►具合の悪い時に客が来る　have a visitor at an inconvenient time
・具合の悪いことに彼女に話を聞かれてしまった.　Unfortunately, she heard about it.
4 〔体裁〕 decency; propriety; social acceptability.
►この服装では具合が悪い.　These are not the right clothes (for the occasion). ｜ I am not fit to be seen in these clothes.
►あんなことのあとで彼に会うのはちょっと具合が悪い.　It ┏wouldn't be quite right [would be rather awkward] for me to see him after what happened.
5 〔方法〕 a manner; a way; a fashion; a style.
►こういう具合に　in this ┏way [manner]; like this
・こういう具合にやるんだよ.　This is ┏the way to do it [how it's done].
・どんな具合にやったらいいですか.　How should ┏I do it [it be done]?

・ぐらぐらするいす　a ┏rickety [shaky] chair
・机がぐらぐらする.　The desk is ┏shaky [unsteady].
・歯がぐらぐらしている.　My tooth is loose.
・判断がぐらぐらする　waver in one's judgment
・机の脚がぐらぐらする.　The legs of the desk are rickety.
・人形の頭がぐらぐらしている.　The doll's head is all but coming off.
・あの人は考えがいつもぐらぐらしている.　He's never able to make up his mind.
►大地がぐらぐらっときた.　The earth shook violently.
・本棚がぐらぐら揺れた.　The bookshelves rocked (violently).
2 〔煮えたっているようす〕
►湯がぐらぐら煮えたっている.　The water is boiling.

〜する stare (fixedly) at…; gaze ┏at [on]…; watch sth intently; peer 《at [into]…》; scrutinize [study] 《sb's face》.
►穴のあくほど凝視する　stare (fixedly) [look hard] at…; scrutinize [study] 《sb's face》; gaze with piercing eyes at…
・一点を凝視する　stare (fixedly) at a point.

ぎょしがたい【御しがたい】 [ローマ字](gyoshigatai)
hard to ┏handle [control, manage]; unmanageable; intractable; 〔馬が〕 《be》 heavy on one's hand.
►御しがたくなる　become ┏unmanageable [uncontrollable]; get beyond (one's) control.
►彼は御しがたい男だ.　He is a difficult man to deal with.

ぎょしん【魚信】 [ローマ字](gyoshin)
a nibble; a bite. [＝あたり２ 9]

ぎょうしんせい【暁新世】 [ローマ字](gyōshinsei)
【地質】 the Paleocene (epoch).

ぎょうしんとう【暁新統】 [ローマ字](gyōshintō)
【地質】 the Paleocone (series).

ぎょしやすい【御し易い】 [ローマ字](gyoshiyasui)
easily manageable; tractable; malleable; easy to deal with; easy to influence.
►彼は御しやすい男だ.　He is an easy man to deal with.

ぎょうしょ【行書】 [ローマ字](gyōsho)
a cursive style of writing (Chinese characters); the running style.
►行書(体)で書く　write in gyōsho.

ぎょうしょう１【行商】 [ローマ字](gyōshō)
an itinerant trade; peddling; hawking.
〜する peddle; hawk; engage in an itinerant trade.
►田舎を行商する　peddle goods about the countryside.
►(地方へ)行商に出かける　go on a peddling tour.
►行商お断り.　〔掲示〕 No Salesmen! ｜ No Hawkers!
◧行商稼業　the peddling trade.
行商人　a *peddler [ᐦpedlar]; a hawker; an itinerant ┏vendor [trader]; a traveling salesman.
►薬の行商人　an itinerant seller [a peddler] of (patent) medicine(s).

ぎょしょう１【魚醤】 [ローマ字](gyoshō)
fish sauce.

ぎょしょう２【魚礁】 [ローマ字](gyoshō)
a rocky place under the water where fish tend to gather; a ┏breeding ground [reef] for fish.
◨人工魚礁　an artificial fish reef.
►廃船を海底に沈めて人工魚礁にする　scuttle a decommissioned ship to create a fish reef on the ocean floor.
